items.title: FAA grounds SpaceX's Starship after midflight explosion, reports property damage on Turks and Caicos
items.content: The FAA grounded SpaceX's Starship pending an investigation into the failure that caused the rocket to break apart midflight after launching on Thursday.
items.contentSnippet: The FAA grounded SpaceX's Starship pending an investigation into the failure that caused the rocket to break apart midflight after launching on Thursday.

items.title: Unrivaled women's basketball league debuts Friday. Here's everything we know about it
items.content: The Unrivaled basketball league will play its first games, airing on TNT, on Friday. It's poised to capitalize on growing national interest in women's sports.
items.contentSnippet: The Unrivaled basketball league will play its first games, airing on TNT, on Friday. It's poised to capitalize on growing national interest in women's sports.

items.title: FTC sues PepsiCo, alleging price discrimination is raising costs for consumers
items.content: The Federal Trade Commission is suing PepsiCo for alleged price discrimination in the final days of the Biden administration.
items.contentSnippet: The Federal Trade Commission is suing PepsiCo for alleged price discrimination in the final days of the Biden administration.

items.title: Ozempic is in the next round of Medicare drug price negotiations. See the full list of 15 medications
items.content: The talks on drugs including Novo Nordisk's Wegovy, GSK's Trelegy Ellipta, and Pfizer's Xtandi will set Medicare prices that go into effect in 2027.
items.contentSnippet: The talks on drugs including Novo Nordisk's Wegovy, GSK's Trelegy Ellipta, and Pfizer's Xtandi will set Medicare prices that go into effect in 2027.

items.title: Why 2025 is set to be a crucial year for Amazon's Zoox robotaxi unit
items.content: This year is expected to be a crucial one for Amazon's Zoox, as the company plans to grow its operations and commercialize a robotaxi business.
items.contentSnippet: This year is expected to be a crucial one for Amazon's Zoox, as the company plans to grow its operations and commercialize a robotaxi business.

items.title: SpaceX's Starship rocket breaks up after launch, flights divert after FAA debris warning
items.content: SpaceX launched the seventh test flight of its Starship rocket on Thursday.
items.contentSnippet: SpaceX launched the seventh test flight of its Starship rocket on Thursday.

items.title: Wall Street banks had a great quarter, and the boom times are just starting
items.content: JPMorgan Chase, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley easily topped estimates for the fourth quarter.
items.contentSnippet: JPMorgan Chase, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley easily topped estimates for the fourth quarter.

items.title: Investors pitch new international basketball league that would offer players equity
items.content: The investors are looking to raise $5 billion to start a basketball league that could offer players equity to potentially lure them away from the NBA.
items.contentSnippet: The investors are looking to raise $5 billion to start a basketball league that could offer players equity to potentially lure them away from the NBA.

items.title: EV, hybrid sales reached a record 20% of U.S. vehicle sales in 2024
Spirit Airlines cuts 200 jobs in bankruptcy cost-cutting scramble
items.content: Spirit Airlines cuts 200 jobs across the airline as it seeks to exit bankruptcy protection this quarter.
items.contentSnippet: Spirit Airlines cuts 200 jobs across the airline as it seeks to exit bankruptcy protection this quarter.

items.title: Target says its holiday sales were better than expected — but its profits weren't
items.content: The big-box retailer's report indicates that deals and promotional events motivated shoppers.
items.contentSnippet: The big-box retailer's report indicates that deals and promotional events motivated shoppers.

items.title: LIV Golf announces multiyear media rights deal with Fox Sports
items.content: LIV Golf announced a media rights agreement with Fox Sports to broadcast the pro golf tour to U.S. viewers just one day after naming a new CEO.
items.contentSnippet: LIV Golf announced a media rights agreement with Fox Sports to broadcast the pro golf tour to U.S. viewers just one day after naming a new CEO.

items.title: Morgan Stanley tops estimates on strong equities and fixed income trading revenue
items.content: While bank stocks have been supported by enthusiasm for rising deal activity, it was actually the trading side that helped Morgan Stanley more in the quarter.
items.contentSnippet: While bank stocks have been supported by enthusiasm for rising deal activity, it was actually the trading side that helped Morgan Stanley more in the quarter.

items.title: Bank of America tops estimates on better-than-expected investment banking, interest income
items.content: The company said fourth-quarter profit more than doubled to $6.67 billion, or 82 cents per share, from a year earlier.
items.contentSnippet: The company said fourth-quarter profit more than doubled to $6.67 billion, or 82 cents per share, from a year earlier.

items.title: Blue Origin’s first New Glenn rocket reaches orbit, misses booster landing
items.content: Blue Origin launched its towering New Glenn rocket for the first time early Monday, in a crucial milestone for Jeff Bezos' space company.
items.contentSnippet: Blue Origin launched its towering New Glenn rocket for the first time early Monday, in a crucial milestone for Jeff Bezos' space company.

items.title: Medicare's new $2,000 cap on out-of-pocket drug costs could save patients thousands, AARP says
items.content: The AARP report suggests the spending cap could be huge for Medicare enrollees who take costly drugs for cancer, rheumatoid arthritis, and other conditions.
items.contentSnippet: The AARP report suggests the spending cap could be huge for Medicare enrollees who take costly drugs for cancer, rheumatoid arthritis, and other conditions.

items.title: DOT sues Southwest, fines Frontier for 'chronically delayed flights'
items.content: The Department of Transportation has sued Southwest Airlines, alleging the carrier operated chronically delayed flights.
items.contentSnippet: The Department of Transportation has sued Southwest Airlines, alleging the carrier operated chronically delayed flights.

items.title: JPMorgan Chase is boosting buybacks even after CEO Jamie Dimon called the stock expensive
items.content: Fresh off a record year for profit and revenue, JPMorgan is facing questions over what CFO Jeremy Barnum admitted was excess capital.
items.contentSnippet: Fresh off a record year for profit and revenue, JPMorgan is facing questions over what CFO Jeremy Barnum admitted was excess capital.

items.title: FTC sues Deere, alleging equipment repair 'monopoly' raises costs for farmers
items.content: The Federal Trade Commission has filed a lawsuit against agricultural equipment giant Deere & Company, alleging it holds a monopoly on repair services.
items.contentSnippet: The Federal Trade Commission has filed a lawsuit against agricultural equipment giant Deere & Company, alleging it holds a monopoly on repair services.

items.title: Disney wins the 2024 box office as year-end receipts offer a welcome boost
items.content: Full-year ticket sales were down just 3.4% from 2023, reaching $8.74 billion, a far cry from the nearly 27% shortage seen at the midway point of 2024.
items.contentSnippet: Full-year ticket sales were down just 3.4% from 2023, reaching $8.74 billion, a far cry from the nearly 27% shortage seen at the midway point of 2024.

items.title: Bristol Myers Squibb says Alzheimer's is the biggest market for new schizophrenia drug
items.content: Bristol Myers Squibb plans to release initial late-stage trial data on Cobenfy in Alzheimer's-related psychosis during the latter part of the year.
items.contentSnippet: Bristol Myers Squibb plans to release initial late-stage trial data on Cobenfy in Alzheimer's-related psychosis during the latter part of the year.

items.title: JPMorgan Chase posts record profit as the bank’s massive scale pays off
items.content: The bank said profit rose 50% to $14 billion in the fourth quarter as noninterest expenses fell 7% from a year earlier.
items.contentSnippet: The bank said profit rose 50% to $14 billion in the fourth quarter as noninterest expenses fell 7% from a year earlier.

items.title: Goldman Sachs shares rise after topping estimates on strong trading results
items.content: Goldman's fourth-quarter results will give investors a preview of what to expect this year, as investment banking and trading fees are both expected to rise.
items.contentSnippet: Goldman's fourth-quarter results will give investors a preview of what to expect this year, as investment banking and trading fees are both expected to rise.

items.title: Firefly Aerospace kicks off first moon mission after SpaceX launch
items.content: The lander of Texas-based rocket and spacecraft builder Firefly Aerospace has begun a 45-day trip to the moon.
items.contentSnippet: The lander of Texas-based rocket and spacecraft builder Firefly Aerospace has begun a 45-day trip to the moon.

items.title: Boeing delivered 30 airplanes in December, but gap with Airbus widened in 2024
items.content: Boeing delivered 348 airplanes in 2024, less than half of rival Airbus's deliveries.
items.contentSnippet: Boeing delivered 348 airplanes in 2024, less than half of rival Airbus's deliveries.

items.title: Eli Lilly shares drop as drugmaker cuts revenue guidance on weight loss drug demand
items.content: Eli Lilly shares dropped after the drugmaker cut its 2024 revenue guidance, citing lower-than-expected demand for its obesity and diabetes drugs.
items.contentSnippet: Eli Lilly shares dropped after the drugmaker cut its 2024 revenue guidance, citing lower-than-expected demand for its obesity and diabetes drugs.

items.title: JPMorgan Chase exec Daniel Pinto, longtime No. 2 to Jamie Dimon, will step down in June
items.content: Pinto has worked at JPMorgan and a predecessor firm for more than four decades.
items.contentSnippet: Pinto has worked at JPMorgan and a predecessor firm for more than four decades.

items.title: Southwest Airlines pauses corporate hiring, most summer internships to cut costs
items.content: Southwest had been under pressure from activist Elliott Investment Management to increase returns.
items.contentSnippet: Southwest had been under pressure from activist Elliott Investment Management to increase returns.

items.title: CFPB sues Capital One for 'cheating' customers out of over $2 billion in interest
items.content: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau announced it was suing Capital One for "cheating" customers out of more than $2 billion in interest.
items.contentSnippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau announced it was suing Capital One for "cheating" customers out of more than $2 billion in interest.

items.title: Entertainment, tech companies donate millions to LA wildfire relief effort
items.content: Companies are pledging millions in donations to aid relief efforts for victims of the Los Angeles wildfires.
